page.title: 05Hawks And Birds Of Prey
page.content: A rural area with a small influx of modern urban settlement. There is an educational annexe in this square which at one time catered for Mature students of the Glamorgan college of Education. It still has facilities for education and is used by the Barry College of Further Education. A large part of this area is wooded and it includes a hawking centre. The Welsh Hawking Centre opened at Weycock Road in 1980 when the former Cardiff Zoo which was based on the same site closed. Traditional zoo animals such as monkeys, lions and tigers have moved out. The centre now houses probably one of the inest collections of hawks and other birds of prey in South Wales.
